intro: Eriogonum bannockense, commonly known as Bannock bunchgrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife. Eriogonum bannockense is also valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in challenging conditions.
